_header: Now Jesu lord and well of all goodness
Bibliographic Ghosts: New York, Pierpont Morgan Library G9 [olim Berkeley], Art. 2: this MS all in Latin; leaves out ME verse in this Latin text.
_description: ‘A deuout prayer toward thy bedde at nyght’ — six quatrains (abab)

BodAsh61.First Lines:
Ihesus Lord well of All godnesffor thi grete pety I þe
                    prayffor gyffe me All my wykidnesWhere with I haue grenyd þe to
                    dey…
BodAsh61.Last Lines:
…My body my soule I þe be kenIn nomine patris &
                        filij & spiritus sancti
BodAsh61.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 194-5.
Shuffleton,  George. 
             Ashmole 61: A Compilation of Popular Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008: 71-2; 452-4; 602.

CamTCC601.First Lines:
now Ihesu lord welle of all goodnesffor þy gret pyte I the
                    pray…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…In nomine patris & filiiEt spiritus sancti
                    Amen
CamTCC601.Attributed Author: John Lydgate (f. 176rb, added by later hand)
CamTCC601.Attributed Title: A deuout prayer toward thy bedde at nyght (f. 276rb)

Perry,  Aaron Jenkins,
                        ed.
